page.title: 05GOSS HALL FARM
page.content: My name is Mary Coleman and my family live at Goss Hall, Ash, Canterbury, Kent. My Dad farms this farm, Great Weddington, Ash and Black Pond Farm, Woodnesborough, in partnership with my grandfather. Total acreage of these three farms is 250 hectares (ha). This year there are 140 ha of crops and 110 ha of grassland. The crops consist of 41 ha of winter wheat, 29 ha of spring barley, 18 ha of spring oats, 27 ha of potatoes and 4 ha of Brussel sprouts. The 108 ha of grassland is used for beef production and hay. We have about 400 head of cattle which are all kept for beef. We also have about 120 sheep-most of these will be sold to other farmers in the Autumn as replacements for their breeding flocks.
